snippet: The absence of their usual big names is hurting the Yankees not only in the standings but at the gate and in the television ratings. Fewer people are watching.
abstract: Absence of star players is costing the New York Yankees not only in the standings but also in ticket sales and in television ratings; through 41 home games this season, Yankees have drawn nearly 106,000 fewer fans than at this point a year ago, 6.1 percent drop that is almost twice as large as the overall decline in baseball; through June 25, television ratings on their Yes Network were down 40 percent to 2.52 from 4.17 at this point last season.

byline.contributor: Richard Sandomir, Ken Belson and Mary Kenney contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The absence of their usual big names is hurting the Yankees not only in the standings but at the gate and in the television ratings. Fewer people are watching.

headline.main: With Fewer Stars at Yankee Stadium, Fewer Fans Are Watching
